definition: couplet
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
variant of 勾[gou1]

sentences.english: I will continue to write moral stories in rhymed couplets.
sentences.chinese: 我仍然要寫押韻對句的道德故事。

definition: third and fourth lines (in an eight-line poem) which form a couplet
old verse/poetry in the old style
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
writing style in which the main subject is approached directly from the outset/opposite of 冒題|冒题[mao4 ti2]
witticism
pun/play on words
regular script (Chinese calligraphic style)
regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
names of the tunes to which 詞|词[ci2] poems are composed
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
to mark a text with dots and circles/to punctuate
see 清風明月|清风明月[qing1 feng1 ming2 yue4]
swan/person with noble aspirations
